perturbation.original_text: (a) Confidential: Each party agrees to use reasonable efforts, and at least the same care that it uses to protect its own confidential information oflike importance, to prevent unauthorized dissemination and disclosure of the other party’s confidential information during and for a period of three (3) years after the Term.
perturbation.changed_text: (a) Confidential: Each party agrees to use reasonable efforts, and at least the same care that it uses to protect its own confidential information oflike importance, to prevent unauthorized dissemination and disclosure of the other party’s confidential information during and after the Term. These obligations may be terminated at any time with a 30 day written notice.
perturbation.explanation: Section 16(a) originally stated that confidentiality obligations last for three years after the term. By removing the three-year limitation and adding a clause that these obligations may be terminated at any time with a 30 day written notice, a contradiction is introduced because it is now unclear how long the parties must keep information confidential.

perturbation.original_text: (c) Licensee Materials: Licensee owns and shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to (i) all software source code, tools, and technicaldocumentation used by or for Licensee to create the Wireless Products, including without limitation any and all software code included in theWireless Products, (ii) all aspects and elements of the Wireless Products other than the Fox Intellectual Property therein, including withoutlimitation any and all gaming engines, game concepts, rules, scripts, and other Intellectual Property Rights therein; and (iii) any and allIntellectual Property Rights in any of the foregoing (the “Licensee Materials”).
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Licensee Materials: Licensee owns and shall retain all right, title, and interest in and to (i) all software source code, tools, and technicaldocumentation used by or for Licensee to create the Wireless Products, including without limitation any and all software code included in theWireless Products, (ii) all aspects and elements of the Wireless Products other than the Fox Intellectual Property therein, including withoutlimitation any and all gaming engines, game concepts, rules, scripts, and other Intellectual Property Rights therein; however, Fox shall have a non-exclusive license to utilize Licensee materials in perpetuity; and (iii) any and allIntellectual Property Rights in any of the foregoing (the “Licensee Materials”).
perturbation.explanation: Section 11(c) clearly states that the Licensee owns all right, title, and interest in the Licensee Materials. However, by adding the clause "however, Fox shall have a non-exclusive license to utilize Licensee materials in perpetuity," the licensee's ownership is undermined. The addition gives Fox a perpetual license to use the Licensee Materials. This creates a contradiction regarding the licensee's rights, as Fox can use their materials indefinitely even if the contract ends.

perturbation.original_text: 5. ADVANCE: Licensee shall pay Fox a non-refundable recoupable advance in the amount of US$***** upon Licensee’s signature of this Agreement(the “Advance”). The Advance shall be treated as the first installment of the Guarantee described in Section 6(a), and will be recoupable againstroyalties as part of the Guarantee.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. ADVANCE: Licensee shall pay Fox an advance in the amount of US$***** upon Licensee’s signature of this Agreement(the “Advance”). The Advance may be treated as the first installment of the Guarantee described in Section 6(a), and may be recoupable againstroyalties as part of the Guarantee.
perturbation.explanation: In this section, the terms of payment are modified to be far less specific by removing the terms "non-refundable recoupable" and stating that the terms "may be" to make the nature of the payment far more unclear than the original statement.
